title: publish seems to publish data "by default" now?
body:
So -- did manage to create remote sibling (see #1273 ), noted btw that none of the 'push' settings aren't yet set in .git/config for that remote (thought that we have had that settled already, I guess I was wrong), and decided to publish
```shell
(venv)mvdoc@smaug /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids (master) $ cat Wheatley/Beau/.git/config            
[core]
        repositoryformatversion = 0
        filemode = true
        bare = false
        logallrefupdates = true
[submodule "1007_personality"]
        url = /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids-test/Wheatley/Beau/1007_personality
[remote "rolando"]
        url = ssh://rolando.cns.dartmouth.edu/inbox/BIDS/Wheatley/Beau
        fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/rolando/*
(venv)mvdoc@smaug /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids (master) $ cd -
/mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids/Wheatley/Beau/1007_personality
(venv)mvdoc@smaug /mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids/Wheatley/Beau/1007_personality (master) $ datalad publish --to=rolando -r                                                                                                
[INFO   ] Publishing <Dataset path=/mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids/Wheatley/Beau/1007_personality> to rolando 
[INFO   ] Publishing data of dataset <Dataset path=/mnt/btrfs/dbic/inbox/bids/Wheatley/Beau/1007_personality> ... 
```
and now staring at the terminal (oh those lovely progress bars -- where are you?) and data meanwhile is flowing...
here actually it is intended for data to eventually being transfered but I do not think I have set it up for that and feels like logic in datalad some where is flawed... I will check whenever it is done copying on some other repository I guess or there is some obvious explanation?
